TopicTitle: Another day in KSP towing an E class...

Articles.Content:
> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/1dpRo)

Trying to eject an E class asteroid out of solar system by brute force. No need for Jool assist. What you see here is a 4000m/s prograde burn node created for that purpose:confused: Kraken must love me so much he always visits when im towing an E class... Anyone found a %100 failproof way to tow these giants?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T10:25:16Z" title="06/09/2015 10:25  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by n0xiety**

![ubrNjgy.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ubrNjgy.jpg)

This is my Ion\*64 craft towing a 4000t asteroid (3997t to be precise). See how much Xenon I get and how much delta V I get after grabbing the asteroid. I literally spent two (Earth) days (although not continuously playing) to tow it from a Ap=150Mm (escaping) orbit to a 81Mm one (that doesn't escape Kerbin) (the screenshot is somewhere yesterday while towing is still in progress).

Just give you a data point of how things would look like and what is achievable. Technically I could reduce my number of Ions to get higher dV, but the towing experience will be much worse...

I think you got me wrong. I am not having problem with dV or thrust. Mining works great and you can practically get more than 10000dV if you mine the whole asteroid while towing it. My problem is the fact that atleast half of my attempts ends up with kraken attack. I must have seen every bug about kraken. Asteroid stoping in orbit, phantom acceleration, unstopable turn, universe disappearing, atmosphere disappearing... All of these happens while towing a big asteroid. There are many more but you get the idea... There needs to be a guide how to use claw without causing kraken attacks...

IMO mining is like defeating the whole purpose of towing, but that's probably just me.

And during my process of towing my 4000t, I haven't seen such krakens that is unknown. I see weird explosion - because my solar clipped into the asteroid and then I warped/quickloaded. I see it spins - because I'm not thrusting against CoM exactly. Other than those, no other issue that caught my eye.

Well look at it this way. Asteroids and comets have water(generally) Turn water into the most used space stage fuel atm = liquid hydrogen and oxygen. Totally doable easily in real life. Besides that much xenon gas would bankrupt my career and still won't be able to eject an E class out of solar system.

It should cost a lot more energy to produce this fuel - sure doable in real life, but on the scale of hundreds of tons? maybe not just with a drill and ISRU and this amount of electricity. Also the ISRU can produce pure LF or pure O with that rate - water might be a bad real life example for it. So I wasn't connecting the mining system with any real life concepts. In my mind asteroid is still something that scientists are most interested in, not engineers - but that's just me.

I don't have much fund pressure in my career so I'm doing that - partly because I used some other mods that over-rewards some contracts and I just wanted to waste the extra money somewhere to balance myself, but whatever...

> 
> I think you got me wrong. I am not having problem with dV or thrust. Mining works great and you can practically get more than 10000dV if you mine the whole asteroid while towing it. My problem is the fact that atleast half of my attempts ends up with kraken attack. I must have seen every bug about kraken. Asteroid stoping in orbit, phantom acceleration, unstopable turn, universe disappearing, atmosphere disappearing... All of these happens while towing a big asteroid. There are many more but you get the idea... There needs to be a guide how to use claw without causing kraken attacks...

After you grapple it save then restart. The Kraken has a short attention span.

Actually, when it comes to ejecting, I guess mining IS the way to do it - reduce the mass.

And yes, quicksave often and when Kraken shows its ugly head, F5, Alt-F4, then start the game again.

Check out the "[Stock bug-fix modules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-KSP-v1-0-4-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules-%28Release-v1-0-4b-2-1-Aug-15%29)". Claw has worked out a pretty reliable fix for the horrible claw issues so this should make asteroid towing a lot less prone to kraken attacks.

> 
> After you grapple it save then restart. The Kraken has a short attention span.

And actually, as it turns out, this won't really prevent claw kraken attacks. I used to think so also, but it turns out to not be the case. It will, however, stop them once they have started. The only problem there is if the kraken has already trashed the orbit, restarting won't fix that if it's been saved.

Cheers,

-Claw
